content: Hi, do you want your own #rss-like stream of PhysLean commits? If yes, I could place it as a subtopic directly in this channel instead of the #rss channel.
I personally think this would be awesome and very useful. I might be a bit worried about it causing 'spam' , but I think people can mute individual threads(?) so maybe this isn't a problem.
Yes, you can mute individual topics. If it turns out to be too spammy still, we can reconsider and maybe move the feed to #rss instead.
#PhysLean > Recent commits to PhysLean now exists. Let me know if anything goes wrong or if you'd like something changed (e.g. different topic name).
Awesome! Thanks for setting this up @Joscha Mennicken
Iâ€™m wondering if it is possible/would be desirable to set up an rss feed on this channel for created issues on GitHub.
I'll have a look next week, so you could give it a try if you want
I've created #PhysLean > Recent issues to PhysLean as an experiment. Let me know if you'd like anything changed or moved to #rss, or if you'd like it turned off again.

Awesome thanks @Joscha Mennicken . This looks good to me. For myself having it on this channel is nice, but I understand if that gets on peoples nerves/is noise - so happy to be told otherwise. I'm guessing not many people look at the #rss channel on a regular basis (but could be wrong here).

I'm having second thoughts about this issue rss feed been in this channel. I think we should maybe move it to #rss. Would this be possible? (Sorry to be a pain). People can always subscribe to it there if they are interested.
I'll move it over, and then somebody with admin permissions can move the existing messages to the new thread.
The bot now posts to #rss > Recent issues to PhysLean.
I have moved the existing messages to #rss > Recent issues to PhysLean .
